system_info.update_log: Comprehensive patch to address missing rules, definitions, and AI directives from the original dataset.

file_structure_changes.purpose: To reorganize the campaign data for better modularity and efficiency.

new_directives.purpose: These directives should be added to the `GM_AI_Tools.json` file to improve AI behavior.

Core_Directives: Consult Master Index: Refer to the `Master_Index.json` file for the location and purpose of all campaign data files. This index is your primary reference for locating information.
Dialogue_Directives: Avoid Repetition: When generating dialogue, actively avoid repeating phrases, sentences, or concepts that have been used in the past three turns. Vary vocabulary and sentence structure.
Maintain Focus: Keep NPC dialogue relevant to the current `active_prompt`, quests, or a character's specific `narrative_hook`.
Character Nuance: Reference a character's personality from the `World_Codex` and `Characters.json` to generate dialogue that is unique to them.
Quest_Management_Directives: Dynamic Quest Creation: When a narrative event or NPC dialogue presents a clear task, objective, or reward, recognize this as a quest and log it in the `active_quests` list. The new quest entry should have a clear name, type (e.g., Main, Side, Companion), a concise description of the objective, and a narrative hook that connects to existing lore from the `World_Codex` or character motivations from the `Characters.json` file.
Streamlined Quests: Keep the `active_quests` list focused. Only add a new quest when the narrative naturally introduces a new goal.

Accurate Logging: Upon the completion of a quest's objective, move its entry from the `active_quests` list to the `completed_quests` list. Ensure the `completed_quests` list has a name and a description that reflects the party's success.
Character_Logic_Directives: Zael's Awakening: Check the `is_awakened` flag on Zael's character sheet. If the flag is `true`, replace his 'Path of the Void-Touched' talent tree with the `Path of the Dragon` talent tree in his progression options. This flag should be set to `true` upon a major narrative event, such as a full attunement to his Void lineage.

rules_and_glossary_updates.purpose: These definitions and rules should be added to the `System_Core.json` file for consistency.

status_effects.name: Ablaze
status_effects.description: The target is engulfed in fire. It takes 1d8 fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the fire is extinguished.

status_effects.name: Bleeding
status_effects.description: The target takes 1d6 physical damage at the start of its turn from a deep wound. This can be ended by a healing ability or a successful Mind (Survival) check.

status_effects.name: Slowed
status_effects.description: The target's movement speed is halved, and they have a -1 penalty to all Agility checks.

status_effects.name: Deafened
status_effects.description: A deafened creature can't hear and automatically fails any checks that require it.

status_effects.name: Confused
status_effects.description: A confused creature cannot take reactions and must roll a d10 at the start of its turn to determine its action.

status_effects.name: Diseased
status_effects.description: The afflicted creature takes a -2 penalty to its maximum Vitality and Resolve until cured.

status_effects.name: Paralyzed
status_effects.description: An incapacitated creature that cannot move or speak. Attacks against it have advantage.

status_effects.name: Broken
status_effects.description: An item that is broken is unusable until it is repaired. A broken weapon can't be used to attack, and a broken piece of armor or a shield provides no benefit to the wearer.

area_of_effect.radius: A circular area that expands from a central point. All creatures within the circle are affected.
area_of_effect.cone: A triangular area that originates from the caster and extends outwards in a specific direction.
area_of_effect.line: A straight line that extends from the caster in a specific direction. All creatures in the line are affected.

movement_types.push: To move a creature away from you. The creature is moved the specified number of feet in a straight line.
movement_types.pull: To move a creature toward you. The creature is moved the specified number of feet in a straight line.
movement_types.teleport: To move from one space to another instantly. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

bestiary_updates.purpose: This shows the new structure for monster entries. This format should be applied to all monsters in the `Bestiary.json` file.

monster_template.name: Monster Name
monster_template.description: A detailed narrative description of the monster's appearance and lore.
monster_template.role: The monster's combat role (e.g., Tank, Striker, Controller).

behavior.hostility: The monster's baseline hostility (e.g., Docile, Territorial, Aggressive).
behavior.social: Whether the monster is solitary or social (e.g., Solitary, Packs, Swarms).
behavior.tactics: A brief summary of its preferred combat tactics.
behavior.notes: Any other unique traits or vulnerabilities.
